About: ATOREC CV 20MG contains the active ingredients called Atorvastatin and Clopidogrel
Atorvastatin belongs to a group of medicines known as statins, which are lipid (fat) regulating medicines
Clopidogrel belongs to a group of medicines called antiplatelet medicinal products
commonSideEffect: inflammation of the nasal passages, pain in the throat, nose bleed
allergic reactions
increases in blood sugar levels (if you have diabetes continue careful monitoring of your blood sugar levels), increase in blood creatine kinase
headache, nausea, constipation, wind, indigestion, diarrhoea
joint pain, muscle pain and back pain
blood test results that show your liver function can become abnormal
seriousSideEffect: swelling of face, tongue and throat that can cause great difficulty in breathing.
serious illness with severe peeling and swelling of the skin, blistering of the skin, mouth, eyes, genitals and fever
Skin rash with pink-red blotches especially on palms of hands or soles of feet which may blister
muscle weakness, tenderness or pain
problems with unexpected or unusual bleeding or bruising, this may be suggestive of a liver complaint

About: ATOREC EZ contains combination of Ezetimibe and Atorvastatin
commonSideEffect: muscle and body pain
changes in your liver function tests
diarrhea
tendon problems
memory loss
confusion
depression
seriousSideEffect: unexplained muscle pain, tenderness, or weakness
feels tired or weak
loss of appetite
dark urine
yellowing of your skin or the whites of your eyes
allergic reactions including swelling of the face, lips, tongue, and/or throat that may cause difficulty in breathing or swallowing
nausea and vomiting
passing brown or dark colored urine
you feel more tired than usual
stomach pain

About: ATOREC F contains Atorvastatin and Fenofibrate
Atorvastatin belongs to a group of medicines known as statins, which are lipid (fat) regulating medicines
Fenofibrate belongs to a group of medicines, commonly known as fibrates. These medicines are used to lower the level of fats (lipids) in the blood
commonSideEffect: inflammation of the nasal passages, pain in the throat, nose bleed
allergic reactions
increases in blood sugar levels (if you have diabetes continue careful monitoring of your blood sugar levels), increase in blood creatine kinase
headache
nausea, constipation, wind, indigestion, diarrhoea
joint pain, muscle pain and back pain
blood test results that show your liver function can become abnormal
seriousSideEffect: serious allergic reaction which causes swelling of face, tongue and throat that can cause great difficulty in breathing

serious illness with severe peeling and swelling of the skin, blistering of the skin, mouth, eyes, genitals and fever. skin rash with pink-red blotches especially on palms of hands or soles of feet which may blister

muscle weakness, tenderness or pain and particularly, if at the same time, you feel unwell or have a high temperature it may be caused by an abnormal muscle breakdown. the abnormal muscle breakdown does not always go away, even after you have stopped taking atorvastatin it can be life-threatening and lead to kidney problems
